parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From en and blepo; to look on, i.e. to observe fixedly, or to discern clearly.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A lamb (as a type of innocence, and with sacrificial connotation). Apparently a primary word; a lamb.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
